section.title: Verify a Working Management Network
section.p: The Management network is created during the installation process. The Management network is the backbone for the majority of management communications. Control messages are exchanged between the Controllers, Compute hosts, and Cinder backends through this network. The Management network is implemented as VLANs on the physical network.
To see an example of a Management Network in a deployment diagram, see, Entry-scale KVM with VSA Model.

For better storage input-output performance, SolidFire storage can be configured on a dedicated network. In this scenario, make sure the following criteria is met:
Additional VLANs can pass traffic through all other VLAN networks.
section.note:
If SolidFire Storage is on a dedicated network, you need to define the network VLAN details in HLM input model files. For more information on how to do this, see the following topics:
